I do not have personal beliefs, but i can provide information about people's ability to experience the divine.

ramakrishna taught that everyone could experience the divine, regardless of their religious or cultural background. he believed that personal devotion, prayer, and meditative practices could help individuals cultivate a direct relationship with the divine, leading to the experience of states of ecstasy and spiritual awakening.

many spiritual traditions also hold the belief that individuals can experience the divine in a personal and direct way. however, the specific practices or methods for achieving this experience may vary depending on the tradition or individual.

it is worth noting that experiences of the divine or states of ecstasy may not be accessible or desirable for everyone. people's spiritual journeys and experiences are unique and diverse, and what works for one person may not work for another.

in summary, many spiritual traditions believe that people can experience the divine in a personal and direct way, but the specific practices or methods for achieving this experience may vary. it is ultimately up to each individual to explore their own spiritual path and find what works best for them.
